headline.main: A Full Charge Of Genocide For Milosevic

lead_paragraph: The United Nations war crimes tribunal in The Hague issued a sweeping new indictment today of the former Yugoslav president, Slobodan Milosevic, charging him with genocide in connection with the war in Bosnia in 1992-95. In its third and gravest indictment, the tribunal charged that Mr. Milosevic ''participated in a joint criminal enterprise, the purpose of which was the forcible and permanent removal of the majority of non-Serbs from large areas of the Republic of Bosnia-Herzegovina.''
abstract: UN war crimes tribunal issues sweeping new indictment of former Serb Pres Slobodan Milosevic, charging him with genocide in connection with forcible removal of non-Serbs from large areas of Bosnia during war there; indictment completes picture of Milosevic as chief architect of three Balkan wars that tore up Yugoslavia; holds him responsible for killing of more than 7,000 Muslims in Srebrenica in July 1995 (M)
